channel.title: Auhome | Mail Online
channel.description: Daily Mail Australia - all the latest Australian news, sport, showbiz, science and health stories from the Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers

item.title: Australia gets thrashed in the Ashes against England and Twitter reacts
item.description: Australia's worst score since 1948 and the lowest score at Trent Bridge cricket ground against England in the Ashes (pictured) sent social media into a frenzy on Thursday night.

item.title: Ada Nicodemou's husband Chrys Xipolitas shares heartbreaking tribute one year after the loss of their stillborn son Harrison
item.description: Using poetry to express the family's loss, Chrys wrote on social media: 'Harrison, I'll always be your father, She'll always be your mother, You'll always be our child, The child that we had.'
item.media:description:
11h chrys_xippoHarrison, I'll always be your father, She'll always be your mother, You'll always be our child, The child that we had.
#foreverinourhearts #angel #alwaysremembered #YNWA #love #harrison @adanicodemou

item.title: Port Douglas home must be rebuilt because it's the same as a neighbours
item.description: Owners of a million dollar mansion in Port Douglas (pictured) have been handed a court order for breaching architectural copyright laws, after it was deemed their home was a replica of a neighbour's.

item.title: 'Happy Hour' debate sees bottom-tier Republicans take shots at Donald Trump
item.description: Rick Perry and Carly Fiorina hammer The Donald, who won't take the stage until four hours later. 'How can you run for the Republican nomination and be for single-payer health care?' Perry asked.

item.title: Today Show's Karl Stefanovic fulfills nudie run after Michael Clarke misses 100 runs in the Ashes
item.description: Karl Stefanovic has fulfilled his promise to do a nudie run on Friday morning's Today Show after Australian cricket captain Michael Clarke was caught out for just 10 runs at The Ashes.

item.title: Newlyweds Jennifer Aniston and Justin Theroux pictured boarding a private jet bound for honeymoon after secret A-list ceremony at Bel Air mansion
item.description: Jennifer Aniston and Justin Theroux were honeymoon bound on Thursday morning as they boarded a private jet after marrying in a secret ceremony at their Bel Air mansion last night.

item.title: Katie Hopkins branded a 'bully' for 'fat shaming' audience member
item.description: The columnist became embroiled in a heated exchange with the woman, known only as Sheryl, when discussing whether fat people ought to pay more when flying.

item.title: Preston Police searching for Jake Derrick facing burglary charges
item.description: A warrant was issued for the arrest of Jake Derrick, also known as Jake Hancock, from Preston, north west of Melbourne, late Thursday night after he failed to appear in court to face burglary charges.

item.title: One in seven over-65s now use social media sites like Facebook and Twitter
item.description: New data shows a sharp rise in silver social surfers in the last three years. Between 2012 and 2015, the proportion of people aged 55 to 64 using social networking sites has doubled.

item.title: Jenson Button and wife Jessica gassed as burglars steal £300k worth of belongings
item.description: Jenson Button was gassed by burglars before having £300,000 worth of belongings stolen from his house in France. The burglars took his wife Jessica's £250,000 engagement ring.

item.title: Andy Murray and Kim Sears announce they are expecting their first baby
item.description: British tennis star Andy Murray and new wife Kim Sears are expecting a baby, it has been reported. The couple, who married in April, are said to be overjoyed by the news.

item.title: Shawn Robinson, 41, found dead in his New Orleans hotel room
item.description: Hollywood stuntman Shawn Robinson, 41, who has worked on Captain America and Transformers, was found dead after he failed to report to work July 28.

item.title: Photographer Jesse Holland captures her dog and daughter posing in identical images
item.description: Jesse Holland, from Victoria, British Columbia, began photographing her daughter Ella and their five-year-old French bulldog/Boston terrier mix Charlie just over a year ago.

item.title: Eating plenty of fruit and veg DOES help us live longer
item.description: Scientists from the Scripps Research Institute in San Diego found that antioxidants can keep a vital organ called the thymus healthy by stopping age-related damage in its tracks.

item.title: Rise of 'Pet-Nup' contracts to decide who keeps the dog if couple split
item.description: Singer Cheryl Fernandez-Versini won custody of her two chihuahuas after her 2010 divorce from footballer Ashley Cole (pictured together).

item.title: Organ donation inquiry was rushed out because of a negative news story
item.description: Assistant Health Minister Fiona Nash accelerated an announcement of an organ donor review after she learned Channel Seven were set to be critical of reforms to the organ donation system.

item.title: Breakfast TV host Karl Stefanovic to take his clothes off live on air
item.description: Today Show host Karl Stefanovic tweeted on Thursday evening while watching the fourth Ashes test that if captain Michael Clarke didn't score 100 runs he would strip off on the show on Friday.

item.title: Christopher Pyne and Anthony Albanese defend use of taxpayers' money to Karl Stefanovic
item.description: Christopher Pyne (pictured) and Anthony Albanese have defended the former's decision to fly his children from Adelaide to Canberra in business class to see him sworn into parliament in 2013.

item.title: New Jersey police chief 'sent fellow officer's wife' begging for sex
item.description: Kenneth Hartman, head of Far Hills Police Department in New Jersey, allegedly sent 22 graphic messages to Officer Jason Shanaphy's wife in just 45 minutes on August 20, 2014.

item.title: Homeless man Michael Migani arrested for giving 'wet willy' to 4-year-old boy
item.description: Michael Migani, 34, was arrested by Shelton, Connecticut police on Wednesday after allegedly giving a 4-year-old boy he didn't know a 'wet willy.'

item.title: Eric Warfel kept his dead baby daughter's decomposed body for month in crib
item.description: An Ohio grand jury on Tuesday chose to indict Eric Warfel, 34, on felony charges of abusing a corpse and tampering with evidence for keeping the corpse of his 21-month-old daughter Ember.

item.title: Breakups hurt women more in the short term but men NEVER recover
item.description: Women reported higher levels of both physical and emotional pain. However, researchers said that, over time, they came put stronger - while men simply moved on and never fully recover.
item.media:description:
Couple arguing over bills.
Image by Artiga Photo/Corbis

item.title: Cilla Black saw a ghost that made her believe she'd see husband Bobby again
item.description: Cilla had held a deep belief in the psychic world since 1990, when a very ghostly experience made her question her inherent scepticism. It was to change her outlook on life . . . and death.

item.title: Wellington man and his 2 kids escape sinking car after it crashed into the sea
item.description: Neighbours woke up to the sound of a crash and children's screams in Wellington, New Zealand, after a car smashed through a fence and rolled into the ocean on Friday morning.

item.title: Yoseop Choi accused of beating his baby boy to death
item.description: A 5-month-old baby boy who was allegedly beaten by his New Jersey father died in the hospital on Thursday. Yoseop Choi, 38, has been charged with murder for his son's death.
item.media:description: A 5-month-old baby boy who New Jersey prosecutors say was beaten by his father has died after more than a week in the hospital. Bergen County Prosecutor John Molinelli says the baby died Thursday at Bellevue Hospital in New York. Molinelli says charges against the baby's father, 38-year-old Yoseop Choi, will be upgraded to homicide. The Fort Lee man was being held on $750,000 bail and charged with aggravated assault and child endangerment. A message left with Choi's attorney wasn't immediately returned.

item.title: Optical illusions video reveals how easy it is to fool our brains
item.description: The video, created by Inside Science TV, takes a look at a number of famous illusions, including the Hermann Grid, the Mach Bands illusion and the rotating snakes.

item.title: Nana Betty, 89, serves as a bridesmaid for her granddaughter Christine Quinn
item.description: Christine Quinn, from Plymouth, Pennsylvania, said she asked Betty Govern, or Nana Betty for short, to stand beside her at her May 2 nuptials simply because she is one of her best friends.

item.title: Bigamist and 'first' wife charged for deaths of his 2nd wife, children and mother-in-law
item.description: Bigamist Christopher Matthew Henderson, 40, (pictured right) and wife Rhonda Carlson, 42, of Alabama, have been charged Thursday in the deaths of four people including his 'second' wife.

item.title: Hangover make up trend in Japan sees women with red puffy eyes and greasy hair
item.description: There is nothing worse than feeling hungover, but LOOKING hungover is the latest beauty trend sweeping Japan. Women apply blush under the eye and create wet-look hair to achieve the look.

item.title: Most embarrassing #fieldworkfail mistakes revealed on Twitter
item.description: From inadvertently eating cheetah faeces to accidentally exchanging saliva with dead animals, the hundreds of tweets show research can be full of amusing blunders.

item.title: Two disabled girls wheelchair dance to Silento's hip hop hit Whip/Nae Nae
item.description: Mayli and Brooklyn learned the dance at their Ayita Wheelchair Dance class in Fort Worth, Texas, which is run by Mayli's mom. The moves are adapted to work around - and work with - their wheelchairs.

item.title: Texas husband surprises his wife Nia Rader by revealing that she's pregnant
item.description: Sam Rader, 29 found out that his wife Nia, 26, was pregnant before she did because the mother-of-two doesn't flush in the middle of the night. So the Texas native broke the news to her on camera.

item.title: Spice Girls 'to reunite for huge world tour WITHOUT Victoria Beckham'
item.description: The girl group released their debut single in 1996 and will celebrate two decades in the spotlight by hitting the road together next year - however, Victoria has decided to sit the trek out.

item.title: Australians choose Uber over regular taxis as it is 40% cheaper
item.description: Daily Mail Australia has compared Uber X to regular taxis and found that they were were consistently 40 per cent cheaper than catching a local taxi (pictured).

item.title: Whitsundays mansion goes on the market at an undisclosed price
item.description: A mansion worth more than $25 million in the Whitsundays, North-Queensland, has been put on the market, arguably the best waterfront property in Australia (pictured).

item.title: Forget the naughty step, reasoning is the best way to tackle tantrums
item.description: Scientists at the National University in the US studied how 102 parents dealt with their children when they were naughty and found the naughty step was one of the least effective approaches.

item.title: Father's tattoo tribute to daughter who has two hearing implants goes viral
item.description: Alistair Campbell, from New Zealand, got the inking done as his daughter Charlotte was due to have her second cochlear implant fitted because she has almost total hearing loss.
item.media:description:
Father gets cochlear implant tattoo to match his daughter So Alistair Campbell shaved all his hair off and had his own implant tattooed onto his bald head to show six-year-old Charlotte how much he loved her. And Charlotte LOVED the gesture. She giggled, touched it and said it was ?cool? when her father had the artwork etched on over the weekend. Mr Campbell also posted a picture to Facebook where it has been shared dozens of times.
Read more: http://metro.co.uk/2015/08/06/amazing-father-gets-cochlear-implant-tattoo-for-his-six-year-old-daughter-5329901/#ixzz3i2TEMtLk Read more: http://metro.co.uk/2015/08/06/amazing-father-gets-cochlear-implant-tattoo-for-his-six-year-old-daughter-5329901/#ixzz3i2TAcOMS

item.title: Tony Burke's expense claims come in for more scrutiny after alleged 'world tour'
item.description: Labor frontbencher Tony Burke (pictured) is under the spotlight again, this time for claiming first class flights for himself and a senior member of staff, who later became his partner.

item.title: Woman with IBS goes from a size ten to a size zero to a size six
item.description: Jenna Birch, 23, from Ann Arbor, Michigan, was a size ten until the age of 21. The writer shrunk to a size zero (left) after suffering from irritable bowel syndrome. She is now a healthy size six (right).

item.title: Tom Brady's diva demands revealed in emails amid Deflategate case
item.description: The New England Patriots quarterback, married to super model Gisele, moaned about the color of his $8,500 swimming pool cover in a strongly-worded message to his manager.

item.title: The injection that can instantly cure drug addicts
item.description: Scripps researchers found a single injection of early drug candidate called blebbistatin cured animals. Researchers hope to first use the drug to treat meth addicts.
item.media:description: Crystal meth cocaine methamphetamine. Image shot 2002. Exact date unknown.

item.title: Russia hacked Pentagon's Joint Chiefs of Staff and shut down its email system
item.description: The 'sophisticated cyber intrusion' occurred sometime around July 25 and impacted military and civilian personnel working inside the Pentagon, reports suggest.

item.title: Australia's batting techniques were exposed at Trent Bridge... there is a time and a place for attacking cricket but sometimes you just have to score ugly
item.description: NASSER HUSSAIN AT TRENT BRIDGE: Sometimes there is no substitute for carving out ugly runs, and the performance of Australia’s batsmen suggested this is something of a dying art.

item.title: Marvin Minsky says artificial intelligence could someday be religious
item.description: Researchers from various fields say the laws of computer science mean robots could someday believe in God, but this won't necessarily make them kind to humanity.

item.title: Alabama teacher Joe Petrey arrested as photos of 'sex romp with student' emerged
item.description: An Alabama high school teacher has been charged with sexual contact with a student after photos surfaced online of him and a recently-graduated student in an inappropriate relationship.

item.title: Real life Popeye Jeff Dabe has 49cm forearms aims for Armwrestling championship
item.description: Jeff Dabe, pictured, from Minnesota, has earned himself the nickname Popeye because of his huge forearms in the World Armwrestling League where he can use his natural advantage.

item.title: Queensland boy, 2, taken by a man who forced him into a car is FOUND
item.description: A desperate search has begun for a little boy snatched from his home near Cairns in Queensland. The toddler was allegedly forced into a silver Ford Falcon (similar to the one pictured).

item.title: Osama bin Laden's family killed in jet crash after pilot had to overtake microlight
item.description: The £7million private jet carrying Bin Laden's stepmother and half-sister also issued six warning alerts before it plunged into a car auction site in Hampshire on Friday, an initial report found.

item.title: New deep-sea anglerfish discovered in the Gulf of Mexico
item.description: The new fish was discovered by a researcher at the Nova Southeastern University's (NSU) Halmos College of Natural Sciences and Oceanography in the gulf of Mexico.

item.title: RollJam $30 'universal car remote' that could give hackers access
item.description: The hacker behind the project says it will open cars from Chrysler, Daewoo, Fiat, GM, Honda, Toyota, Volvo, Volkswagen Group, Clifford, Shurlok, and Jaguar.

item.title: The Lion King animator honors Cecil with illustration inspired by Disney classic
item.description: Aaron Blaise is a Disney animator who worked on the 1994 hit film. fter being 'extremely moved' by the slaughter of Cecil the Lion, he honored the late animal with a Lion King-inspired picture.

item.title: From skirts to Speedos, how men's swimsuit styles have evolved over 100 years
item.description: The new clip, which was created by Mode, charts the evolution of the swimsuit over the past 100 years, beginning in 1915 when swimming dresses were the swimsuit of choice, to present day.

item.title: Maryland man discovers he is heir to the throne of the Isle of Man
item.description: In the new TLC reality series Suddenly Royal, David Drew Howe, 45, an auto-repair specialist from Maryland, takes his wife Pam and their daughter Grace to the UK to learn how to act like royalty.

item.title: Wendy Zabrocki survived double suicide pact with husband of 35 years in Folkestone
item.description: Melvyn and Wendy Zabrocki downed a lethal cocktail of drugs and alcohol before laying down on the bed to die at their home in Folkestone, Kent, last November, an inquest heard.

item.title: The heart shredding betrayal when your husband sleeps with the nanny
item.description: Mother-of-two Abigail Murphy, 38, from Surrey, was betrayed by her husband Ben. He left her for their nanny of 15 months, who was 23.

item.title: LG reveals it WILL sell flip phone mobile with 3MP camera in US and UK
item.description: Called the LG Wine Smart, the handset has a 3.2-inch colour touch screen and runs Android Lollipop 5.1. It also has physical buttons and a 3.2mp camera, and is expected to cost around $170 (£109).

item.title: ISIS executes 19 girls for refusing to have sex with fighters
item.description: The women were being held in the ISIS stronghold of Mosul, Iraq, and refused to take part in the perversely-named practice of 'sexual jihad', according to a Kurdish official stationed in the same city (file photo).

item.title: Minder’s George Cole dies aged 90
item.description: Acclaimed actor George Cole who starred as the loveable rogue Arthur Daley in the hit ITV series Minder and had a career spanning more than 70 years, has died aged 90.

item.title: Cecil the lion’s cubs have been adopted by their uncle Jericho
item.description: The infant lions have been adopted by their new pride leader, under the watchful eye of their uncle Jericho, in Hwange National Park, Zimbabwe.

item.title: Madonna admits she has to pay an aide to remind her to eat due to tour
item.description: The music icon, who is kicking off her Rebel Heart tour on September 9 in Montreal, revealed that she has been spending 10 to 12 hours a day prepping for the series of performances.

item.title: Dancer Daysha Phillips dies from illegal butt injection by women on police bail
item.description: Daysha Phillips, 22, is said to have got the illicit lift with three other women inside a room at a Drury Inn in St Louis, Missouri, on July 26. Two days later she was rushed to hospital with breathing problems.

item.title: Queen Letizia sparks fears over health after revealing frighteningly skinny arms in Palma
item.description: The Spanish royal, 42, showed off a pair of extremely slender arms as she welcomed guests to the La Almudaina Palace in Palma last night. Letizia is currently holidaying in Mallorca with her family.

item.title: Twin saved in China's first operation to divide conjoined babies thanks doctor
item.description: Doctors worked over 10 hours to separate the twins in successful surgery. Operation was the first successful separation of conjoined twins in China. Gu Qiao is now 19 and will go to university soon.

item.title: MailOnline parents share new snaps of their babies' magnificent hair
item.description: After it was revealed that Fergus Hillman, six months, from Cornwall needs constant trims, hundreds of MailOnline readers sent in pictures of their coiffed cuties with full heads of hair.

item.title: Shocking moment a bull is ‘illegally’ executed with shotgun on Spanish street
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The bull, called Guapetón, was shot dead in Coria, south-west Spain, after he attacked a man during the town's annual bull running festival - sparking outrage from animal rights groups.

item.title: Groom brought a room to tears by dropping to his knees to dance with his mother
item.description: In 2008, Luke Rheault, 33, from Fitchburg, Massachusetts, danced with his ALS-stricken mother Rebekah at his wedding, less than a year before she died, and didn't watch the video until now.

item.title: Migrants in Macedonia race to catch the last trains into Europe
item.description: Waiting for trains that will continue their journey on to western European nations like Germany and France, the migrants were photographed at a run-down train station in the town Gevgelija.

item.title: Benefits of weight-loss surgery only last 5 years
item.description: While many obese patients lose weight in the first year after bariatric operations, experts at Tel Aviv University say after five years many begin to regain the pounds they initially shed.

item.title: Photographer Lilana Taboas Cruz celebrates mothers' postpartum bodies
item.description: Puerto Rican American photographer Liliana Taboas Cruz, 27, started her project, Divine Mothering after suffering a miscarriage. The mother-of-two now photographs mothers of all ages.

item.title: Chinese sex education teaches pupils about condoms and masturbation with parents
item.description: A special summer camp was held last week in Chongqing, southwest China. Pupil aged 11 to 18 attended the three-day event with their parents to learn more about their bodies.

item.title: Australian homeowners looking for 'smaller but nicer' houses they can afford
item.description: Despite the huge property bubble in major cities home ownership is falling in Australia, and the homes that people do own now are much smaller than they were a generation ago.

item.title: PE teachers see overweight children as less intelligent and less social
item.description: A new study has found PE teachers have a 'strong anti-fat bias' with some saying being obese is 'pretty much worse than dying'. So if you were bullied at school it wasn't just all in your head.

item.title: New film of Dutch crane crash shows terrified people running for their lives
item.description: The dramatic new video shows how people walking along a quiet city street in the central city of Alphen aan den Rijn were forced to run for their lives as the cranes started to topple.

item.title: GoFish 'GoPro for fishing' camera attaches to a line to film underwater
item.description: Houston-based brothers Ryan and Brandon Austin have developed the GoFish Cam that attaches to a line and can work at depths of 150 metres to reveal the moment a fish takes a bait.

item.title: Apprentice star Stuart Baggs died as a result of his asthma
item.description: Stuart Baggs was found dead at his home on the Isle of Man by police last Thursday just days after his 27th birthday. Police revealed that he died of 'natural causes' as a result of his asthma.

item.title: Nadine Baggott's video tutorial shows you how to look good when you're over 40
item.description: Nadine Baggott, 53, from London, who has worked in the industry for over 20 years, has created a video tutorial showing mature women how to make the most of their skin.

item.title: Meet 15-year-old Nic Tata who is 6 foot 10 inches tall
item.description: Fifteen-year-old Nic Tata (pictured) is already 6 feet 10 inches and has been told by doctors he will keep growing, although he likes being tall, the prospect of continuing to grow 'scares' him.

item.title: Camera fitted to hammerhead shark shows how it stalks its prey
item.description: The GoPro camera stayed on the shark's fin for almost three hours and took in a tour of the sea bed to give photographer Mr Casagrande a unique viewpoint of the creature's adventures.

item.title: This man visit EVERY country in the world before he reached 40
item.description: Gunnar Garfors, from Norway, has travelled to all 198 countries around the world by the time he reached 37. He has released a book on his journey called 198: How I Ran Out Of Countries.

item.title: KFC, Taco Bell and Nando's reveal secret menus
item.description: The secret KFC dishes include the Ultimate Zinger (a mash-up of the Ultimate Burger with a Zinger fillet); and the Zinger Stacker (two Zinger Fillets, two slices of cheese, spicy sauce and chili relish).

item.title: Beauty hacks to shave minutes off your morning regime
item.description: Whether it's choosing double-duty products or getting organised with your cosmetics, it all plays a hand in keeping morning routines fuss and stress-free. FEMAIL rounds up the top tricks.

item.title: Melbourne father and son falsely accused of being paedophiles
item.description: A father and son could sue up to $375,000 for defamation of character, after a fake Victoria Police letter was sent around their Melbourne neighbourhood.

item.title: Relatives of MH370 victims refuse to believe wing fragment came from plane
item.description: Aircraft seats and windows have now washed up ashore on Reunion Island - the same location a piece of plane wing from missing passenger jet MH370 was discovered one week ago.

item.title: The shocking reality for male victims of domestic violence
item.description: One in three victims of domestic violence are males, but there are little support services available to these men. One man alleged to have been stabbed five times by his ex-wife (pictured).

item.title: Restaurant popular with tourists on Australia's Sunshine Coast fined £10,000
item.description: The Centrepoint Buffet is located in Caloundra, close to popular beaches and surf spots. On the restaurant's website it is described as 'Australia's most popular take away'.

item.title: Women with breast implants are THREE times more likely to commit suicide
item.description: Women who get breast implants may already have psychiatric problems to do with lower self-esteem or body image disorders, according to researchers from the Vanderbilt University Medical Center.

item.title: ISIS seize Qaryatain town in central Syria home to tens of thousands of Christians
item.description: The heavily populated town of Qaryatain lies south west of Palmyra, which is home to towering Roman ruins, and is located some 50 miles from the Assad regime-held city of Homs.

item.title: Miss Bumbum model Andressa Urach reveals her sordid life as a 'luxury hooker'
item.description: Brazilian Andressa Urach, 28, is writing tell-all book about how she fell into a squalid life as a hooker, bedding millionaire businessmen and married football stars around the world.

item.title: Are these the world's weirdest wedding photos?
item.description: Couples are showing their creative side in unusual wedding photos from around the world, including a barely-dressed bride, half-horse newlyweds and face-painted couple.

item.title: Algerian man sues wife one day after wedding after seeing her without make-up
item.description: The husband told an Algerian court that he was so shocked after seeing his bride's face the day after their wedding that he failed to even recognise her - accusing her of being a thief that had broken in.

item.title: Rare photographs show the aftermath of Hiroshima after the atomic bomb
item.description: Horrifically injured locals are pictured wandering along flattened streets strewn with corpses in the western Japanese city only hours after the nuclear bomb, nicknamed 'Little Boy', was dropped.

item.title: Can the first selfie make-up kit help you cheat your way to flawless skin?
item.description: Smashbox Cosmetics has teamed up with smartphone brand HTC to launch a Selfie Kit - the ultimate makeup kit specifically designed to make users look selfie-perfect.

item.title: Plane passengers terrified as captain is forced to smash down toilet door with an AXE
item.description: Passengers on the flight between Stockholm and Örnsköldsvik in eastern Sweden saw the pilot smash down the door after the passenger repeatedly refused to come out.

item.title: Couple's 'holiday from hell' at five-star Caribbean resort of Aruba
item.description: Debbie Williams and Ian Gibson travelled to the island of Aruba on a two-week holiday that cost them more than £3,800 with Thomson - but were left shocked by the state of their hotel.

item.title: Canva CEO Melanie Perkins believes her success is due to NOT having any experience
item.description: Melanie Perkins was a 19-year-old university student when she started her first company. Now 28, Ms Perkins has founded another multi-million dollar design company run out of Sydney and Manila.

item.title: A driver and passenger have miraculously escaped a horror car crash
item.description: A driver and passenger have miraculously escaped with their lives after crashing into a guard rail, which tore their vehicle apart (pictured).

item.title: Bernard Tomic challenges a point he WON at the Citi Open
item.description: Aussie tennis player Bernard Tomic is one of the most argumentative players on the circuit. His bizarre display during a Washington Open match on Wednesday indicates nothing's changed.

item.title: Feminism photos by photographer Liora K captures topless women fighting sexism
item.description: Photographer Liora K moved to Tucson, Arizona, in 2010 and has since struggled with the state's treatment of women's rights, so she created the new photo series to help women fight for their rights.

item.title: Troy Phillip Milbourne accused of abusing a 13-year-old-girl pictured
item.description: A man who is accused of being a member of a shocking paedophile ring has been granted bail but remains behind bars because no one will pay his $5000 surety.

item.title: Mako shark jumps 12 feet into the air alongside boat and terrifies the fisherman on board in incredible footage
item.description: This is the incredible moment a Mako shark propelled itself from the water alongside a fishing boat and reached heights of up to 12 feet – terrifying the fisherman on board in California.

item.title: These are the world's most haunted hotels
item.description: For adventurous travellers looking for a night to remember, consider checking into these spooky spots, including a converted prison and a luxurious Italian residence haunted by Mussolini.

item.title: Ukrainian soldiers post photographs of their pets on front line online
item.description: Ukrainian soldiers have given a rare insight into life on the frontline by surprisingly posting pictures of their beloved pet dogs and kittens.

item.title: Two people are found dead in a bullet-ridden car in north-west Melbourne
item.description: The windscreen of the silver Ford, which was found on Taylors Road in Plumpton (pictured) - north-west of Melbourne - had been pierced by several bullet holes, with the two people inside.

item.title: Hidden costs of new GST on online products mean you will pay up to 50 per cent MORE
item.description: Online shoppers will be forced to pay much more than an extra 10 per cent if the GST is charged on item bought overseas that cost less than $1000, experts warn.

item.title: Australia's most baffling missing persons cases revealed by AFP
item.description: They are the most baffling missing persons cases in Australia, victims of revenge kills and the sex trade. 364 unexplained disappearances which are jointly investigated by the AFP and local authorities.

item.title: Robert Downey Jr's rise, fall and rebirth in Hollywood thanks to Iron Man
item.description: After being tipped for stardom, Robert Downey Jr spent the late 1990s and early 2000s addicted to drugs and spending regular stints in LA County jail.

item.title: Jane Birkin boycotts the crocodile bag named after her because of torture
item.description: Fans: (From left) Reality star Kim Kardashian, heiress Petra Ecclestone and Victoria Beckham with their Birkin bags.

item.title: James Packer sells his Vaucluse home La Mer for record $70 million to Chau Chak Wing
item.description: The extensive estate in Vaucluse, in Sydney's east, was lived in by the casino tycoon and his former partner, Erica, back in 2013 when it was completed before news of their break-up emerged

item.title: Bonds forced to recall Newbies Coverall baby suit after a mother finds a NEEDLE in hers
item.description: Bonds is recalling a popular baby jumpsuit made in China after a broken sewing needle was found by a Melbourne mother about to put the garment on her baby daughter.

item.title: Jesus' image seen on La Paz bathroom wall in Mexico home
item.description: Elvia de la Toba's daughter first spotted what they believe is a depiction of Jesus Christ on Monday in a cinder block in their home near La Paz.

item.title: China is selling tickets to new Earth-like planet Kepler-452b for just TWO PENCE
item.description: The listing offering tickets to the potentially habitable Kepler-452b appeared on Taobao, the Chinese equivalent to eBay. But unfortunately the newly discovered exo-planet is 1,400 light years away.
